subsubsection.title: Vocabulary
subsubsection.p:
Look up the definitions of new terms in the Glossary.
Absolute value equation
Absolute value inequality
Error tolerance

li.p: The absolute value is used to model distance: The distance between two points x and a is given by \abs{x - a}.

assemblage.title: Absolute Value Equations
assemblage.p: The equation \abs{ax + b} = c \hphantom{break} (c \gt 0) is equivalent to ax + b = c ~~\text{ or }~~ ax + b = -c

assemblage.title: Absolute Value Inequalities
assemblage.p:
Suppose the solutions of the equation \abs{ax+b}=c are r and s, with r \lt s. Then
The solutions of \abs{ax+b} \lt c are r \lt x \lt s
The solutions of \abs{ax+b} \gt c are x \lt r ~~\text{ or }~~ x \gt s

li.p: The error tolerance e in a measurement M can be expressed as \abs{x - M}\lt e, or as x = M \pm e. Both indicate that M - e\lt x\lt M + e.
Write a function that models the distance between x and a fixed point k on the number line.
For what values of c does the equation \abs{ax + b} = c have one solution? No solution?
If you know that the solutions of \abs{ax + b}\lt c are -3\lt x\lt 6, what are the solutions of \abs{ax + b}\gt c?
What is the center of the interval [220, 238]?
What is the center of the interval [a, b]?
